class.name: SkeletonModification2DJiggle
class.brief_description: A modification that jiggles [Bone2D] nodes as they move towards a target.
class.description: This modification moves a series of bones, typically called a bone chain, towards a target. What makes this modification special is that it calculates the velocity and acceleration for each bone in the bone chain, and runs a very light physics-like calculation using the inputted values. This allows the bones to overshoot the target and "jiggle" around. It can be configured to act more like a spring, or sway around like cloth might. This modification is useful for adding additional motion to things like hair, the edges of clothing, and more. It has several settings to that allow control over how the joint moves when the target moves. [b]Note:[/b] The Jiggle modifier has [code]jiggle_joints[/code], which are the data objects that hold the data for each joint in the Jiggle chain. This is different from than [Bone2D] nodes! Jiggle joints hold the data needed for each [Bone2D] in the bone chain used by the Jiggle modification.

method.name: get_collision_mask
method.description: Returns the collision mask used by the Jiggle modifier when collisions are enabled.

method.name: get_jiggle_joint_bone2d_node
method.description: Returns the [Bone2D] node assigned to the Jiggle joint at [param joint_idx].

method.name: get_jiggle_joint_bone_index
method.description: Returns the index of the [Bone2D] node assigned to the Jiggle joint at [param joint_idx].

method.name: get_jiggle_joint_damping
method.description: Returns the amount of damping of the Jiggle joint at [param joint_idx].

method.name: get_jiggle_joint_gravity
method.description: Returns a [Vector2] representing the amount of gravity the Jiggle joint at [param joint_idx] is influenced by.

method.name: get_jiggle_joint_mass
method.description: Returns the amount of mass of the jiggle joint at [param joint_idx].

method.name: get_jiggle_joint_override
method.description: Returns a boolean that indicates whether the joint at [param joint_idx] is overriding the default Jiggle joint data defined in the modification.

method.name: get_jiggle_joint_stiffness
method.description: Returns the stiffness of the Jiggle joint at [param joint_idx].

method.name: get_jiggle_joint_use_gravity
method.description: Returns a boolean that indicates whether the joint at [param joint_idx] is using gravity or not.

method.name: get_use_colliders
method.description: Returns whether the jiggle modifier is taking physics colliders into account when solving.

method.name: set_collision_mask
method.description: Sets the collision mask that the Jiggle modifier will use when reacting to colliders, if the Jiggle modifier is set to take colliders into account.

method.name: set_jiggle_joint_bone2d_node
method.description: Sets the [Bone2D] node assigned to the Jiggle joint at [param joint_idx].

method.name: set_jiggle_joint_bone_index
method.description: Sets the bone index, [param bone_idx], of the Jiggle joint at [param joint_idx]. When possible, this will also update the [code]bone2d_node[/code] of the Jiggle joint based on data provided by the linked skeleton.

method.name: set_jiggle_joint_damping
method.description: Sets the amount of damping of the Jiggle joint at [param joint_idx].

method.name: set_jiggle_joint_gravity
method.description: Sets the gravity vector of the Jiggle joint at [param joint_idx].

method.name: set_jiggle_joint_mass
method.description: Sets the of mass of the Jiggle joint at [param joint_idx].

method.name: set_jiggle_joint_override
method.description: Sets whether the Jiggle joint at [param joint_idx] should override the default Jiggle joint settings. Setting this to [code]true[/code] will make the joint use its own settings rather than the default ones attached to the modification.

method.name: set_jiggle_joint_stiffness
method.description: Sets the of stiffness of the Jiggle joint at [param joint_idx].

method.name: set_jiggle_joint_use_gravity
method.description: Sets whether the Jiggle joint at [param joint_idx] should use gravity.

method.name: set_use_colliders
method.description: If [code]true[/code], the Jiggle modifier will take colliders into account, keeping them from entering into these collision objects.

members.member: The default amount of damping applied to the Jiggle joints, if they are not overridden. Higher values lead to more of the calculated velocity being applied.
The default amount of gravity applied to the Jiggle joints, if they are not overridden.
The amount of Jiggle joints in the Jiggle modification.
The default amount of mass assigned to the Jiggle joints, if they are not overridden. Higher values lead to faster movements and more overshooting.
The default amount of stiffness assigned to the Jiggle joints, if they are not overridden. Higher values act more like springs, quickly moving into the correct position.
The NodePath to the node that is the target for the Jiggle modification. This node is what the Jiggle chain will attempt to rotate the bone chain to.
Whether the gravity vector, [member gravity], should be applied to the Jiggle joints, assuming they are not overriding the default settings.
